intro: Drypetes amazonica var. amazonica, commonly known as the Amazonian drypetes, is a small to medium-sized tree native to the tropical rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and lanceolate leaves with a dark green upper surface. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by orange-red fruits that contain several seeds. It is often found in lowland and montane forest habitats, contributing to the biodiversity of its ecosystem.
